fields.description:
h5. Summary

Documentation theme add-on  can get enabled automatically when we re-enable Confluence Quicknav add-on

h5. Environment

Confluence 5.9.2 , 5.9.4

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to Manage add-ons and view all add-ons
# Disable *Confluence quicknav add-on*
# Disable *Documentation Theme add-on*
# Enable *Confluence quicknav add-on*
# Refresh the page and look for Documentation theme add-on

h5. Expected Results

The Documentation theme add-on should remain disabled

h5. Actual Results

The documentation theme add-on is enabled automatically

h5. Additional Notes

Affects the below system add-ons as well
# Confluence Easy-User Admin
fields.summary: Disabled system add-on enabled automatically

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
Attachment file will not be migrated but remained in the original folder within the file system when a page (this includes the child pages) is moved between Confluence spaces. The attachment file may not be re-archived properly according to the new page and space hierarchy. As a result, a broken image will appear on Confluence page and the following errors will return upon selecting the attachment from the attachments list via "*•••*" > *Attachments (#)*.
{panel}
h3. Attachment File Not Found

The attachment you were trying to download could not be found in the attachment file store. Either the file has been deleted manually or there was an error in removing the record of the attachment from Confluence.

If this attachment is no longer required you can delete it from Confluence on the attachments page. Otherwise, you will need to attach a new copy.
{panel}

h3. Steps To Reproduce
# *Create* a new Confluence space. (Let's name it "_Space A_").
# *Create* a new Confluence page in _Space A_. (Let's name it "_Parent Page_").
# *Create* three child pages under _Parent Page_ and insert 10 attachments into each pages.
# *Create* a new Confluence space. (Let's name it "_Space B_").
# *Move* the _Parent Page_ from _Space A_ to _Space B_.
# Access the child pages and observe the results. Otherwise, you may access the attachments list via *•••* > *Attachments (#)*.

(i) Alternatively, you may download and install the {{.jsp}} file [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+resolve+missing+attachments+in+Confluence] to determine the exact number of missing attachments via http://<baseURL>/admin/find_and_recover_attachments-3.1.x-v5.jsp .

h3. Expected Behaviour
All attachments under the _Parent Page_ should be moved from _Space A_ to _Space B_ respectively.

h3. Actual Behaviour
Attachments are broken and cannot be found with the following errors thrown.
{panel}
h3. Attachment File Not Found

The attachment you were trying to download could not be found in the attachment file store. Either the file has been deleted manually or there was an error in removing the record of the attachment from Confluence.

If this attachment is no longer required you can delete it from Confluence on the attachments page. Otherwise, you will need to attach a new copy.
{panel}
fields.summary: Attachment File Not Found - in children pages when a page is moved to another space
As Administrator I want to download the Support Zip

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40647].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there's no possibility to hide rows in a table in Confluence. This can cause issues if the table is particularly large.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide option to hide rows in a table to save load time.

Was previously requested in 2011 in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-20098 but was closed.

h3. Workaround
Install [Table Filters and Charts for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.stiltsoft.confluence.plugin.tablefilter.tablefilter/cloud/overview]
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to hide or collapse rows in a table.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40646].
  {panel}

Confluence converts labels to  lower-case, while JIRA maintains the original case of the label as it was entered.

E.g. in JIRA I have 'DevOps', 'DoD', ... and in Confluence this becomes 'devops', 'dod', etc.

* Would be nice if Confluence would act similar to JIRA and keep the case I specify.
* Would be great if there was a way to synchronise labels between JIRA and Confluence so one does not have to enter them twice (synchronization on/off could be a config setting)
fields.summary: Make labels case-sensitive in Confluence just like in JIRA (or sync labels altogether)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40634].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
Index snapshots are currently stored (and being compressed) on the shared home folder of Confluence Data Center. The compression process uses significant disk I/O, that may affect the cluster performance negatively, possibly causing service degradation.

h4. Proposed solution
Allow administrators of large instances to specify different filesystems for the snapshots, to better manage disk utilization and make sure that packing the index snapshots is performed on a local filesystem (local home).
fields.summary: Allow for Data Centre index snapshots to be created in an alternative location

fields.description:
This bug is able to reproduce on a vanilla environment 5.8.8 and above. (only in IE)

1. I created a new page added an image to the content section.

2. Saved page.

3. Clicked on the image and hold click then move picture to a different place in the content 
section.

4. The picture is uploaded again as new attachment
fields.summary: pictures/images re-upload in view page mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40630].
  {panel}

* Upload an Image Attachment multiple times so it has more than one version
* Embed the image to a page and add a comment to the image (using the file viewer UI)
* Go to the attachments page and delete any single historical version of this attachment

This has two impacts:
* It will incorrectly unindex all comments (and attachments although this is rarely seen) from all versions of the content in the edge index.  This has the impact that attachment comments will fall off the popular stream tab of the dashboard (even for versions that still exist).
* Its extremely slow and gets slower and slower depending how many attachment versions you have.

The fix:
* Only unindex the child information of the attachment version being deleted
fields.summary: Deleting Attachment Version unindexes all Comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40628].
  {panel}

Confluence text editor removes formatting when deleting a row.
h4. How to reproduce:
# Create a new page
# Create a row with paragraph format and type 'paragraph text'.
# Press enter twice to create blank row or blank space line
# Create a row with heading 1 formatting and type 'heading 1 text'
# Save the page
# Edit page
# Put the editor cursor to the blank row and press delete key.

h4. Actual behavior:
Row with heading 1 formatting moved up 1 row and drop its formatting
h4. Expected behavior:
The row with heading 1 formatting should retain its formatting after deleting the blank row.
fields.summary: Confluece text editor removes text formatting when deleting a row
Default Attachments Template / Global Attachments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40626].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently there isn't a method via the UI to view space permissions and page restrictions for all the spaces and pages in your confluence instance. 

h3. Suggested Solution
 Create a built in UI report that uses [Confluence rpc and soap calls|https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/confluence-rest-api/confluence-xml-rpc-and-soap-apis] to pull the info into a nice GUI report. Also perhaps add a permission helper similar to the one in JIRA. 

h3. Workaround

In cloud there isn't one as soap and rpc remote calls are [restricted in confluence cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/restricted-functions-in-confluence-cloud-734070955.html]. However this would work in BTF.
fields.summary: Provide ability to quickly audit permissions via a confluence permissions report.
Confluence throws "projectId has no value" in logs while creating a JIRA issue
Provide progress bar for Confluence to monitor upgrade process

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40623].
  {panel}

h2.First Symptom

When a user watch a space, and configured only receive a daily email report summarising all changes that you have permission to view, but receiving changes of every content instead of summary




*Steps to replicate*
* Install a new confluence 5.8.16
* Configure a mail server with GMAIL
* Go to profile, setting, [Email setting|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/email-notifications-145162.html]
* Uncheck all option but {{Subscribe to daily updates}}
!setting.JPG|thumbnail!
* Watch a space
!watch.JPG|thumbnail!
* Login *as other user*, make some changes, or create some new page on the watched space

*Expected Behavior*

Receiving a daily summary only

*Actual Behavior*

Receiving email from every changes of the space, included the changed content of the page
!email.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Subscribe to daily updates not working, receiving a show changed content email instead.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40621].
  {panel}

Hi guys. 

I hope this is the correct project to raise this issue. I was going to raise it against Connect, but that's on EAN and I don't have access right now. Please feel free to move it if required.

Steps to reproduce:

# Create a connect add-on listening to the "page_updated" webhook event.
# Create a page which contains a link to another page.
# Delete the page containing the link.
# Edit and rename the other page (which was linked to by the now-deleted page)

*bug* A webhook page_updated event is fired for the deleted page. Whilst this may seem useful, it just causes confusion as requesting the URI for the page returns a 404. 

Cheers.

~Dave
fields.summary: Webhook event is fired for Trashed page

fields.description:
The FileContentEventListener assumes that the event contains a user (originatingUser.getKey().getStringValue()).  If the event is called outside the scope of a request (from a scheduled job for example) then there will be no user and this code will cause a NPE.

Suggest to guard against this possibility by properly checking for NULL.

Set to *minor* because it looks like the exception is logged but there is no impact to the original request, but there will probably be an impact in the fact that the eventPublisher is not called.
fields.summary: NullPointerException in FileContentEventListener
Export to Word does not render checkboxes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40616].
  {panel}

Customer is not able to search for issues on Confluence on edit mode anymore.

Steps to reproduce:

Instance presenting the issue: https://profoundmedical.atlassian.net

1. Insert a JIRA issue into a large Confluence page (CTRL+SHIFT+J...) and note the inserted issue's key
2. Save the page
3. Reopen the page for edit
4. Use CTRL+F with the key of JIRA issue from #1 

Please investigate

Thanks and regards,
Bernardo | Atlassian Cloud
fields.summary: Impossible to search for JIRA issues on Confluence page in edit mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40615].
  {panel}

Hi,
Just a quick one!
After creating an Epic in our Jira project I frequently received questions on what the priority of the issues within it should be, however each of the issues had their own priorities assigned to them if users had taken the time to check - so it dawned on me that a useful feature would be including, ideally, the ability to select which data to show in the Epic's table of issues, or failing that at least show the priority column within that table.  If this is deemed a good suggestion could I ask that it's implemented for Jira Cloud.
Hopefully that's clear, cheers and good work!
- A
fields.summary: Show selectable columns in Epics
Typo in example code

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we tried to install Japanese language pack ( [^Confluence-5.9.4-language-pack-ja_JP.jar] ) on Confluence, the installation failed with no error.

The installation seemed to be succeeded at a glance but it actually failed.

In spite of the fact that we tried to install *Confluence Japanese Language Pack 5.9.4*, the dialog indicated that Confluence succeeded in installing  *6.0.0-OD-2015.50.0-0611* (the default bundled language pack).
 !lang_pack_install.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Download *Confluence Japanese Language Pack 5.9.4* from [http://translations.atlassian.com]
# Install the language pack from *Manage add-ons* page on Confluece

h3. Expected Results
Language packs should be installed correctly as they were on Conflunece 5.8.x.

h3. Actual Results
Any language pack was not able to be installed.

h3.Workaround
Remove the default bundled language pack and install the new language pack from *Manage add-ons* page.

h3. Note
Confluence Japanese Language Pack 5.9.4 was released after 6.0.0-OD-2015.50.0-0611 had been released *even though the version number is smaller*.
It might cause this bug.
fields.summary: Can't install language pack
Temporary lack of migration from Confluence Cloud to Server for instances that have opted-in for collaborative editing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40611].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Start a Cloud instance with JIRA Core (_not_ Software) and Confluence.
# Create a project in JIRA and Confluence.
# Add a new issue in JIRA.
# Create a page in Confluence and add the JIRA issue above in with a JIRA Issues Macro.
# Click on the "1 JIRA issue" link at the top of the page.

h3. Expected results
The user sees the linked JIRA issue and that's all.

h3. Actual results
The user _does_ see the linked JIRA issue, but also an error saying "Unable to retrieve JIRA metadata. One or more application links have not been configured correctly.":

!error.png!

h3. Notes
This doesn't interfere with the operation of the JIRA links dialog, they're all tracked correctly, it's just not a good user experience.

This is coming from the confluence-jira-metadata plugin. It hits several endpoints in JIRA, but the one that's causing problems is {{/rest/greenhopper/1.0/api/sprints/remotelink}} which is returning a 403 and the error "You currently don't have access to perform this operation".
fields.summary: Confluence returns "Unable to retrieve JIRA metadata" message in linked JIRA issues dialog when linked JIRA is Core-only rather than Software

h3. Summary
The thumbnails in the 'Attachments' macro do not appear on a published page. However, they appear in the Edit  macro dialog and when previewing a page before saving it.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Edit page and add Attachment macro
# Hit preview on the macro 
# Save the page

h3. Expected Results
Page should render the images attached
h3. Actual Results
Nothing is showing
 
h3. Workaround
Preview image using the *Preview* button in the Attachments macro.
fields.summary: Attachments macro preview broken

fields.description:
The edit in place function can be broken by placing certain macros on a page. When broken if you scroll up, the edit button doesn't reappear until you reach the top of the page. While I have seen this on several pages (and not been able to isolate the problem) I did recreate the problem in the following way.

# Create a new page
# Insert many lines of text, multiple paragraphs so the page will result in scrolling when saved.
# Save the page
# Verify that the edit button (and other buttons) reappear when you scroll up.
# Edit the page again and add a {roadmap planner} macro at bottom of the page.
# Save the page
# Scroll down page and then scroll up - Edit button does not reappear.
# Revert to previous version of page - Works.

I have seen this with other pages without the {roadmap planner} macro, but have not been able to isolate.
fields.summary: Edit button doesn't reappear when scrolling up - edit in place

fields.description: The superscript markup ^1^ works in wiki pages, but not within tables.  There it just looks like the markup.
fields.summary: Superscripts not working in tables

fields.description: There is definitely content in my space with the label _reports_ but when I try to see the content with that label, there is no content listed.  This happens in the Labels List macro, where the _reports_ label shows up in the list but then upon clicking, there is nothing listed.  Also, when I try to use this label in the the Content by Label macro, no content shows up.
fields.summary: "Content by Label" macro for label "reports" does not produce results

fields.description:
If you create more than 5 Markers and are viewing by week the markers will go off track by one week after the 4th or 5th one.

It looks fine while editing but when you go to preview or save you will notice that line 4 and all future lines will pull in one week.   Just label the markers 1, 2, 3, 4, 5.  Put bars in between (1-2, 2-3, 3-4, etc)  Then save and you'll see gaps.  I attached screen shots.

We are on Confluence 5.8.9.  It does not matter if I use Chrome or Safari.

Thank You!
fields.summary: Confluence Roadmap Planner - Markers Bug

fields.description:
Confluence 5.8.17
Chrome Version 46.0.2490.86 (64-bit)

Steps to reproduce:
Create a confluence page - give it a title
Add a code macro - put some text in
Save page

Double click the text in the code macro.
Note how the code macro starts replicating in size until you click outside the code macro box somewhere. 

This does not occur in firefox. Have reproduced with multiple users running chrome.

It's like when you pour water on gremlins...

h4. Summary Confluence did not render value of Environment (System Field) with Wiki Markup renderer h4. Steps to reproduce the Problem # Enter value with wiki markup into _Environment_ field (in an issue in JIRA) for example: *Test* (using {{ * }} tag # Add JIRA issue into Confluence page (using JIRA issue/filter macro) # Choose *display option* to show _Environment_ field h4. Expected Result Confluence page will render the value of _Environment_ field properly as *Test* h4. Actual Result Confluence renders the value of _Environment_ field properly as

Test

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! h4. Additional Information Tested in JIRA 7.0.5 with Confluence 5.8.5 > *not reproducible* Tested in JIRA 7.0.5 with Confluence 5.9.1 > *reproducible*

The  PDF/Word page export does not display the second page of the Task Report macro. For example, if you have 23 task in the task report  macro, you will get 2 page. When the page is exported to PDF/Word, only the first page (first 20 entry) will be displayed.

When searching for the content of any Expert macro, the results may be displayed as a page preview of the excerpted content (an option similar to the one available in Livesearch macro, which you can search for page excerpt).

h3. Steps to Reproduce

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40582].
  {panel}

Hello,

It happens to me a lot when I am editing or adding a page, that at the same time I think of a colleague that I want to share the page with. So that he/she sees that I've added a page or that I wanted him to know about this (and future information) 

Therefore it would come in handy that in Edit-modus, you can add a watcher, so when you save the page, the colleague gets informed instantly.

I think it's the best place to add it next to the icons from label/restriction. I think an extra icon, in green or someting, would definately be clear to see. 

Hope you can have a look into this :)
fields.summary: Add a watcher while editing / adding a page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40579].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When viewing a ‘Space List’ macro with ’Space Scope’ in ‘Categories’, switching categories is not updating the space lists, always showing the spaces for the first selected category.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 spaces (say ‘Space A’ and ‘Space B’)
# Add two _different_ categories for each space (Say category ‘A’ for ‘Space A’ and ‘B’ for ‘Space B)
#* Also, make sure these spaces only belong to one of these categories
# Create a page with a ‘Space List’ macro
#* When adding the macro, select ‘category’ in ’Scope of spaces’, leave the rest as default
# Save the page and open it
# In ‘View Spaces With Categories’ switch from category ‘A’ to ‘B’.

h3. Expected Results
The listed spaces should be updated to the ones using category ‘B’. In this case, ‘Space A’ should disappear and ‘Space B’ be shown.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing changes. No matter what category we select, the list of spaces is never updated.

Refreshing the page also doesn’t help, the category is switched back to the first one.

h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: Space list macro is not updating categories when selected

fields.description:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40574].
  {panel}

The User List macro (also known as UserLister macro) documented in [this article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/user-list-macro-139546.html] does not work as expected on Confluence 5.9.x and later versions. It works perfectly fine on versions prior to Confluence 5.9 series.

h3. Expected Behavior
The User List macro returns a list of *online* users based on the preset group(s) if the "*_Display Online/Offline Users_*" parameter is flagged as "*true*". The list includes the user account you are logged into.

h3. Actual Behavior
The list does not return any users along with the message "*_No results were found for groups : confluence-administrators,confluence-users_*". In other words, all users fell under "*offline*" status regardless of the users' activity.

h3. Workaround
To enable the Display Online/Offline Users filter in the User List macro (from comments):
# Go to (Cog wheel) > Add-ons
# Select System from the drop down and search for the User Lister add-on
# Expand the add-on and enable the User Log In Listener module.
# Restart Confluence for the change to take effect.
fields.summary: UserLister Macro Does Not Work As Expected
Wrong icons for copy table row and paste table row

fields.description: Copy page is failing silently on developer.atlassian.com. Editor just refreshes, but no page is created. there's no message or error.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40568].
  {panel}

Strange issue.

I installed multi-excerpt macro. 

It was working.

I then noticed error when I would edit the multi excerpt: "Multiexcerpt "excerpt_name" not found. Note that nested multiexcerpt macros are not supported."

If I then saved - or cancelled - that edit, and saved - or "closed" the page without saving, I would get errors from then onwards on the source page (the one with the excerpt) and the include page (the one with the multi excerpt include).  FRUSTRATING

I then noticed if I did a page preview and saved it, it would fix the error. Weird.

This error, along with CONF-40499 means that I have wasted HOURS with simple attempts to display info from multiple pages on a summary page using page properties reports and/or multi-excerpt includes. now that I know a page preview will fix it I have a workaround but these two bugs need to be fixed for this system of excerpt/include, page properties/report to work!!
fields.summary: Multi Excerpt gives errors after it is edited; can only be fixed via page preview
Table of Contents Macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the Livesearch macro in Confluence and enabling the page excerpt in Additional information, the excerpted content is just ignored when trying to search for it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Insert Excerpt macro in a page within space "X". Write "abc" in the Excerpt macro.
# Insert Livesearch macro in space "X. 
# Edit Livesearch macro and choose page exceprt under Additional information option.
# Search for "abc" in Livesearch macro.

h3. Expected Results

It should result the excerpted content from Excerpt macro.

h3. Actual Results

Instead, it results the page in which the Excerpt macro is inserted in.
If disabling the page excerpt under Additional information option from Livesearch macro, the result is the same: when searching for "abc", it results the page itself. So, the excerpt macro is just ignored.

h3. Workaround

No workaround available yet.
fields.summary: Livesearch macro ignores page excerpt option

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40559].
  {panel}

When a draft of a page fails to save, a popup is placed directly over the document editor tools. 

This is a suggestion to follow two approaches:

h5.Option One

Put this notification literally anywhere else. Just moving it down as few as 2 or 3 EM would allow the user to continue using the tools while the popup is in place. 

h5.Option Two

Allow the user to permanently disable this notification for a session.
fields.summary: Change Pop up Notification Behaviour

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40556].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Based on [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/office-connector-prerequisites-170493096.html#OfficeConnectorPrerequisites-EditingOfficefilesattachedtoapage] Office connector is only available for Windows XP, Vista, 7, and 8.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the most recent version of this platform working with Office Connector.
 
h3. Workaround 
- Some users are able to Open/Edit Office Documents using: Internet Explorer 11 with Office 2013 on Windows 10
- FireFox displays a message indicating that is requires the Office Connector plugin configured to allow authentication tokens in the URL Path; this is not something configurable in the Cloud Environment.
fields.summary: Support Windows 10 for Office Connector
Enable the use of Smart Querying on the JIRA Issues Macro

fields.description:
Hi,

In our organization, we recently upgraded to JIRA 7.0.4, and are using it in combination with Confluence 5.9.3

After the upgrade, I discovered that the table of contents in Confluence doesn't show the title and status but instead it says

Issue: SWUPS-707 - Getting issue details... STATUS
Test Case: Do something
Test Case: Do something else
Issue: SWUPS-805 - Getting issue details... STATUS
Test Case: Do something
Test Case: Do something else

Like if table of contents is being generated before everything has been fetched from JIRA.

But scrolling down the page, the actual content is displaying the title and status bar as supposed to. And if I edit the table of content settings, I see both title and status in the preview pane.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
 # Confluence connected to JIRA
 # Create/Edit a page
 # Add/create a JIRA issue on the page
 # Before this JIRA issue macro add a heading text eg: "issue :"
 # Add a Table of contents macro
 # Save the page

h5. Expected results

The JIRA issue should show the Summary and Status of the issue in Table of Contents macro

h5. Actual results

The JIRA issue details (i.e. summary and status is not shown and instead we see {{Issue: SWUPS-707 - Getting issue details... STATUS}} )
fields.summary: Table of contents having trouble to fetch all information from JIRA
Can the HTML include macro be configured to use HTTP basic auth?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40546].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As an admin, the Office Connector should use the "Content Type" parameter instead of "File Name" to determine Office Connector Functions. When files are renamed and the extension on Office files is removed, the "View" button is not displayed.

Steps to reproduce: 
# Enable the Office Connector.
# Create a Blank Page with the Attachment macro. 
# Add an office attachment. 
# Save the page.
# Notice the Attachment macro will have the "View" button enabled.
# Once verified, open the Properties option from the Attachment Macro.
#  Remove the file extension from the *File Name* field and save. 
# Notice the *View* button is no longer present and when attempting to Edit in Office, it is also unresponsive.

h3. Suggested Solution
# The Office Connector should use the "Content Type" parameter instead of "File Name" in case end users change the File Name. The content type should be a constant identifier for Office files.
# Add better logging to indicate within the log files that the file extension is not a known one

h3. Workaround 
Add the file extension to the File Name.
fields.summary: As an admin, the Office Connector should use the "Content Type" parameter instead of "File Name" to determine Office Connector Functions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40545].
  {panel}

the "recently updated"-list stopped to be updated. This is also shown in the dashboard "All Updates"-list. 
Only a manually Reindexi updates the list one time. Further edits, or creations after that will not be recognised. 
These steps I have already tried without any success.:
1. deleted the index-files; reboot server; manuall reindex
2. deleted plugins cache like described in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+clear+Confluence+plugins+cache
3. added the 3 files from patch.zip of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-39825
(but did not make changes on the database, because it is on our Oracle-Cluster)
;reboot server; manuall reindex

Please help. 

Regards, 
Bernhard Wessel
fields.summary: The dashboard "All Updates"-list with the 'recently updated pages' will not be updated

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When running Confluence 5.9.4 on MySQL 5.6.x, content indexing takes much longer (anywhere from 6-10 times as much time) compared to when running on MySQL 5.5.x or any other version of MySQL running on a Confluence version 5.8.x


h3. Environment
* Ubuntu 14.04
* Confluence 5.9.4
* MySQL 5.6.27
* MySQL 5.5.46
* MySQL 5.6.21
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Stand up a Confluence 5.9.4
# Fill it with content
# Reindex (from scratch or otherwise)
# Compare the amount it takes for the same content on Confluence 5.8.x or Confluence 5.9.4 with MySQL 5.5

h3. Expected Results
In a Confluence 5.9.4 instance running on MySQL 5.5, indexing from scratch takes about 9 seconds.

h3. Actual Results
With this same amount of content (restored from backup) running on MySQL 5.6 the indexing takes around 1 minute. This is not such a significant change, but this occurs when indexing ~3500 pieces of content. We have multiple tickets with much larger instances in support reporting upwards of 40 hours to complete a re-index.

h3.Workaround
At this point, we have been unable to find a workaround. The following has been attempted to see if it addresses the issue from a mysql bug: https://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=74739
{quote}
Meanwhile you have two options to avoid this problem: either disable query caching on server (by setting 'query_cache_size=0' or 'query_cache_type=OFF' http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.5/en/query-cache.html) or stop using cursor fetch in client (connection property 'useCursorFetch=false').
{quote}

This could be a regression of the following bug found immediately after upgrading to Confluence 5.9.x, but it seems like there is a more general issue with indexing and MySQl in Confluence 5.9: [CONF-39746|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-39746]

Other related bugs have also been closed as support requests, but so far support has been unable to find a solution to this issue:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-40134
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-40399
fields.summary: Overall slowness in indexing with Confluence 5.9.x and MySQL 5.6

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40538].
  {panel}

We have customized the PDF Export with organization specific header/footer and it works when exporting a space but not when exporting a page.

I understand the workaround is to export a single page from the space-export tool, but that is not intuitive and does not make much logical sense UI-wise.

Our staff would like to export a page using the ... button on the page itself and have it include the header/footer.

Could we please have that implemented (maybe even offer an admin-configurable optional button to enable/disable the page-specific layout)?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Apply PDF Layout Configuration to page-export

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40537].
  {panel}

We have a local Confluence instance and experienced a very "hostile" limitation of fundamental functionality in the system after exceeding the 250 user limit that our license includes. 

After we exceeded the limit to 255 users the functions to save a page (either after creating a pager or editing a page) were disabled for all current users and the attached error appeared.

I find this a very drastic consequence with a very negative affect towards the customer experience - instead of just throwing an error if user no. 251 is being created. 

Hope you can find a more graceful solution to this.

Brgds.
Sigurdur
fields.summary: Limited functionality for users after exceeding the user license limit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40536].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
*com.atlassian.bonnie.search.extractor.ExtractorException* occurred when we build search index on Word files which passwords are set on.
I understand that it is not possible to create search index on contents in a Word files which passwords are set on, however, I think the exception should be handled correctly.
Could you suppress the exception with handling it correctly?

h3. Environments
* Confluence 5.8.x
* Confluence 5.9.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attach  [^test_password.docx] (the password is 'test') to a page in Confluence
# Rebuild index
# Check *atlassian-confluence.log*

h3. Expected Results
No exception occurred.

h3. Actual Results
Following errors appeared in *atlassian-confluence.log*.

{noformat}

	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:502)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When I try to copy only a pictogram (like (/)) in Edit page on Firefox, it accidentally contains a newline character as well.

(i) This problem never occurred on Chrome and IE.

h3. Environment
* OS : Linux
* Database : MySQL, PostgreSQL
* Product : Confluence 5.9.4 (The original version reported by the customer is 5.7.x)
* Client Browser : Firefox 43.0.4 (Latest Stable)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Edit page in Confluence
# Write a pictogram on the page
# Focus the pictogram and copy it
# Paste from the clipboard after the pictogram you copied

h3. Expected Results
Confluence should behave as it is on Chrome and IE.

Especially on the Step 3, the pictogram which is being focused should be highlighted as follows.
 !focus (chrome).png|thumbnail! 

On the Step 4, the pictogram should be pasted immediately after the one you copied as follows.
 !paste (chrome).png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
On the Step 3, the pictogram being focused was not highlighted on Firefox as follow.
 !focus (firefox).png|thumbnail! 

On the Step 4, the pictogram was pasted on the new line as follows.
 !paste (firefox).png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When I try to copy only a pictogram in Edit page on Firefox, it accidentally contains a newline character as well
Allow to set maximum number of Attachment per page
Deep link to answer is not working in CQ because the first input is automatically focused

fields.description:
h5.Steps to reproduce
Download the two attachments:
# [^1450773_English-named_Files_Download_test.txt] 
# [^1450774_Korean-named_Files_Download_test_한글파일.txt] 

Attach both files to a Confluence page. Upon saving and subsequent edits, the korean file name will be rendered as "unknown attachment"

h5.Testing Notes
# The file can be downloaded through the Attachments screen
# The file can be linked to as a link (Insert » Link » Files)
# The file name displays correctly everywhere else
fields.summary: The View File Macro does not render attachments with multibyte filenames

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40527].
  {panel}

When editing a Confluence page, the shortcuts that are used elsewhere on the system no longer work. Please add an editing mode that respects system keyboard shortcuts.

This is not the same as wanting to configure custom shortcuts as requested in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-23940
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-26156

Rather, it is a matter of using the existing keyboard shortcuts but having them work in Confluence as they do elsewhere.
fields.summary: Allow system keyboard shortcuts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40526].
  {panel}

When attempting to delete a comment on an image attached to a page, sometimes the menu containing the delete option disappears, and I am unable to delete the comment.

See attachment, its the menu in the top right, opened by clicking the elipsis on the comment.

To reproduce:
- Create a new page
- Attach an image
- Add an inline comment to the image
- Refresh the page
- Click the image, open comments
- On the comment, click the elipsis menu several times  - you will notice flickering.
fields.summary: Elipsis menu for inline comments on page attachments flickers and occasionally disappears when trying to delete
Gliffy Confluence 6.8.8 is ready for release to Cloud / OnDemand instances

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On Confluence 5.9.x, when on a page that requires scrolling to see the end, the header bar (Confluence, Spaces, People, Browse, Create) stays along the top of the page when you scroll. However, when the Table of Contents Zone or Roadmap Planner macro is added to the page, when scrolling, the bar does not stay along the top of the page but scrolls like the rest of the content. This has been verified to be the case when using the default them. When using the documentation theme, the header bar stays along the top of the screen when scrolling.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Confluence page with enough content that you will need to scroll to see the end of it
 # Scroll to the bottom and notice that the top bar stays locked to the top of the page
 # Add a Table of Contents Zone or Roadmap Planner macro to the top of the page (you do not need to set any variables in the macro)
 # Scroll again, and notice that top bar is missing when scrolling down.

h3. Expected Results

We would expect to see the top bar remain locked to the top regardless of the macros on the page
h3. Actual Results

When the Table of Contents Zone or Roadmap Planner Macro is added, the top bar scrolls with the content and disappears as the page scrolls
h3. Notes

This is only an issue on the default theme. When using the documentation theme, the top bar remains locked as expected. I am testing on my vanilla Confluence instance with no added plugins or themes.
h3. Solution / Workaround

Don't use the Table of Contents Zone or Roadmap Planner macro
fields.summary: Global navigation bar disappears when scrolling on pages with TOC Zone Macro and Roadmap Planner macro
